Title: I Created Entire App in 30 Min With ChatGPT
Description: I have been playing around with ChatGPT for quite some time now and have used it for quite a few things like blog posts, generation of thumbnails, simple programs, random research on certain topics, etc,. Now I wanted to see just how useful ChatGPT can be if I am starting a project from scratch. I started working on this project called Echoes of Eternity. The app sounds very fancy but it’s actually very simple.

Title: Radically user-centered design
Description: Most product teams have a mandate to put the user first. Based on the state of the web, that seems more like empty lip service than a serious design principle. But I believe truly user-centric digital product design is possible.

Title: Dynamic blocks are the key to reusable Terraform modules · Mijndert Stuij
Description: In the realm of Amazon Web Services there’s this thing called a Landing Zone, a set of infrastructure as code modules built to deploy new environments faster. You can build a Landing Zone using CloudFormation, CDK, Terraform, or any other tool you like. The point is that you have a starting point for as many use-cases as possible. For a Landing Zone to work you have to write reusable generalized code that could work for any client and any combination of infrastructure.

Title: Concurrent write problem
Description:
Introduction
Concurrency control is one of the most challenging aspects of software development. Sometimes, we have a tendency to wishful thinking and naive beliefs that our advanced toolkit like a web framework, a database or an ORM solve all our issues seamlessly underhood. However, when we tackle non-trivial problems (like concurrent write), we have to demonstrate some understanding of how these tools genuinely work (and maybe why they are configured in a specific way).

Title: Will ChatGPT replace .NET developers?
